  • Method Details

    • createInstance

      public static void createInstance(int kPort, int length)
      Creates a new instance of the LEDStrip class if one does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      kPort - the port the LED strip is connected to
      length - the length of the LED strip in number of LEDs

    • setFullPattern

      public void setFullPattern(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern pattern)
      Sets the default pattern to be used when the LED strip is not being controlled by a command. This pattern will be used when the LED strip is not being controlled by a command, such as when the robot is disabled or when no commands are currently running that control the LED strip.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the default pattern to use when the LED strip is not being controlled by a command

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Gets the length of the LED strip in number of LEDs.
      Returns:
      the length of the LED strip

    • runPattern

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command runPattern()
      Runs the active patterns on the LED strip, applying the colors specified by the patterns to the corresponding LEDs.
      Returns:
      a command that runs the active patterns on the LED strip

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Periodically sends the latest LED color data to the LED strip for it to display.
      Specified by:
      periodic in interface edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
      Overrides:
      periodic in class GenericSubsystem

    • setSegmentActive

      public static void setSegmentActive(String name, boolean active)
      Sets whether the pattern with the given name is active or not. If the name does not correspond to a pattern, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the pattern to set whether it is active or not
      active - Whether the pattern is active or not

    • addSegment

      public static void addSegment(String name, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern pattern, int startIndex, int length)
      Adds a pattern to the LED strip with the given name, starting at the given index and spanning the given length. The pattern is active by default. If the name already corresponds to a pattern, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the pattern to add
      pattern - The pattern to add
      startIndex - The starting index of the pattern
      length - The length of the pattern

    • addSegment

      public static void addSegment(String name, int startIndex, int length)

    • removeSegment

      public static void removeSegment(String name)
      Removes the pattern with the given name from the LED strip. If no pattern with the given name exists, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the pattern to remove

    • clearSegments

      public static void clearSegments()
      Clears all active patterns on the LED strip. This method is useful for completely clearing the LED strip of all patterns before running a new command.

    • setCommand

      public static void setCommand(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command defaultCommand)
      Sets the default command to be run by the LED subsystem. If the LED subsystem has not been initialized yet, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      defaultCommand - the default command to be run by the LED subsystem

    • changeSegmentPattern

      public static void changeSegmentPattern(String name, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern pattern)
      Updates the pattern of the active pattern with the given name. If no active pattern with the given name exists, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the active pattern to update
      pattern - The new pattern for the active pattern

    • getRainbowPattern

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern getRainbowPattern(double percentScrollingSpeed)
      Returns a new LEDPattern that sets all LEDs to a rainbow color, and scrolls the pattern at the given speed.
      Parameters:
      percentScrollingSpeed - the speed at which to scroll the pattern, as a percentage of the pattern's length per second
      Returns:
      the new LEDPattern

    • getSolidPattern

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern getSolidPattern(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color color)
      Returns a new LEDPattern that sets all LEDs to the given solid color.
      Parameters:
      color - The color to set all LEDs to
      Returns:
      The new solid color pattern

    • getMaskedPattern

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern getMaskedPattern(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern basePattern, double percentVisible, double percentScrollingSpeed)
      Returns a new LEDPattern that masks the given base pattern with a band of given visibility and scrolling speed. The mask has a band of white (visible) that is percentVisible of the pattern's length wide, centered at percentVisible of the pattern's length from the start of the pattern. The rest of the mask is black (invisible). The resulting pattern is then scrolled at the given speed.
      Parameters:
      basePattern - the base pattern to mask
      percentVisible - the percentage of the pattern's length that is visible
      percentScrollingSpeed - the speed at which to scroll the pattern, as a percentage of the pattern's length per second
      Returns:
      the new masked and scrolling pattern

    • getBand

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern getBand(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern basePattern, double bandCenter, double percentWidth, double percentScrollingSpeed)
      Returns a new LEDPattern that masks the given base pattern with a band of given center and width, and scrolls the resulting pattern at the given speed.
      Parameters:
      basePattern - the base pattern to mask
      bandCenter - the center of the band, as a percentage of the pattern's length
      percentWidth - the width of the band, as a percentage of the pattern's length
      percentScrollingSpeed - the speed at which to scroll the pattern, as a percentage of the pattern's length per second
      Returns:
      the new masked and scrolling pattern

    • getBlinkingPattern

      public static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern getBlinkingPattern(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.LEDPattern basePattern, edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Time blinkInterval)
      Returns a new LEDPattern that blinks the given base pattern at the given interval.
      Parameters:
      basePattern - the base pattern to blink
      blinkInterval - the interval at which to blink the pattern
      Returns:
      the new blinking pattern
